sub_topic: Finding the maximum or minimum value of a trigonometric function
message_1: A Ferris wheel has a radius of 30 meters, and completes one revolution in 2 minutes. Find the maximum height of a passenger if the passenger gets onto the wheel at ground level. (Assume the center of the wheel is at ground level)
message_2:
If the center of the Ferris wheel is at ground level, then the maximum height a passenger can reach is when they are at the top of the wheel. Since the radius of the wheel is 30 meters, the maximum height a passenger can reach is equal to the diameter of the wheel (twice the radius).

Maximum height = 2 * radius = 2 * 30 meters = 60 meters.

So, the maximum height a passenger can reach is 60 meters.
